channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report X-2023080632
item.description:
Report X-2023080632

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered on Unload Door 51 already damaged. DescribePack: One of the cans were bent around cap area, causing cap to loosen and internal leakage to occur. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The leak was contained to the package.

item.title: Report X-2023080610
item.description:
Report X-2023080610

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND INSIDE OF A NON-HAZARDOUS TOTE. THE PACKAGE HAD A STRONG ACID SMELL COMING FROM INSIDE. DescribePack: THE CORROSIVE TORN THE CARDBOARD BOX INTO PIECES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PROPERLY HANDLE USING THE CORRECT HAZARDOUS MATERIALS NEEDED.

item.title: Report E-2023080834
item.description:
Report E-2023080834

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of thinner (un1193) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 5 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
